description: Continued use of lawful Class A1 unit as cafe / restaurant (Class A3) at ground floor level including the installation of a ventilation flue at rear.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - In accordance with the recommendations of the submitted background noise survey dated April 2006 by Paul Gillieron Acoustic Design the extract ventilation system shall be fitted with an inline silencer on the fan outlet to achieve the identified insertion losses, in order to prevent the transmission of noise and or vibration to any other parts of the building and adjoining premises. The extraction equipment shall be maintained and retained as such.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, EN19 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and the requirements of policies SD6, SD7, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 2 - The use hereby permitted shall not be commenced before the fume extraction system and any associated measures for the mitigation of noise and/or vibration have been installed and brought into working order. The equipment shall be maintained and retained as such.

Reason: To preserve the residential amenity of adjoining residential occupiers and the area generally in accordance with the provisions of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, EN19 and  DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and the requirements of policies SD6, SD7, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 3 - No customers shall be on the premises in connection with the use between 23.30 hours and 11.00 hours the following day and no sound emanating from these premises shall be audible within any adjoining premises between these hours.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and of policy SD6 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 4 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and the requirements of policies SD6, SD7, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 5 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 6 - Before the use commences, the extraction system shall be fitted with an electronic timer programmed to prevent the operation of the system outside of the consented opening hours. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, DS6 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and of policies SD6, SD7, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
Condition : 7 - No music shall be played on the premises in such a way as to be audible within any adjoining premises or on the adjoining highway. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000, and policies SD6 and R3 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.
